Pros and cons?

Discuss.

<iframe width="459" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/r0F7E0gzeI0?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Not any worse than trepanning. If the hits are superficial and not causing lasting damage, "curing" people through placebo effect, it works. Real medical attention is always better, but hard to find such things in a place where there are none, and if this is saving people, it is acceptable.

Would be much better if they have a shaman who is an actual botanist and use herbal medicine though.

I've found that hitting my thumb with a hammer makes me forget all about having a headache.
The sound of hitting is so bennyhillian. ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)

> 
> if this is saving people, it is acceptable.

It's not.
Just give the guy a damn ibuprofen, jesus.
I would think that would *give* you a headache lol.

> 
> It's not.

Then it is not acceptable. I do not have knowledge of the situation there and any of my opinion is about as valid as a sneeze in the wind. I am simply saying that, while it is objectively better to have an actual medical professional looking into health problems, there are cases that we can't get those objectively better things, and have to settle for shady methods, which sometimes work thanks to placebo effect. Kind of like acupuncture. It doesn't do any actual medical effect that we know of. But it doesn't harm people in any way physically, and the placebo effect helps people feel better. 

Of course, this is all out of the window when someone is trying to peddle placebo for actual treatment for the same price. That should be shut down.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-24T20:45:23Z" title="03/24/2015 08:45  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 24, 2015</time> by Motokid600**
Axe works better against headaches. No one ever complained.

As someone who suffered, and I do mean suffered, from migraines my usual method involves 4 extra strength Advil Liquid Gels to get home, then 4 Tylenol with codeine and the darkest, quietest room or closet in my house until it stops. If it is in the spring/summer that is usually when my neighbor will fine tune his Harley. Ouch ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

My biggest hate is for people who say 'Migraines? Oh those are just bad headaches right'. At that point I wish for vice to stuff their head in and an icepick so I can make them, maybe, understand what it's like.

It's unconventional, but if it works and isn't destructive, then I see no reason so condemn it.

For example, when I get headaches I take about a fistful of hair from the very top of my head and pull until the pressure outways the headache. It works for me.

No drugs required.
Someone told me that many brain cells are going to die with only one slap onto the head like that. Not sure if that is true.
Better than drilling holes in your head to "relieve the pressure"
